intro: Erigeron dolomiticola, commonly known as the Dolomite fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the limestone hills of the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as rocky slopes and grassy areas. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron dolomiticola is adapted to calcareous soils and is often found in areas with poor, well-drained soil conditions.
